ai-patthana7.22:0.2_0: under the investigation of principles consisting in thoughts.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, nor gives rise to satisfaction, this is a cause for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_1: Not for the sake of non-existence, etc., doesn’t give rise to the repulsion of the teaching.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_2: Not for the sake of non-existence, etc., doesn’t give rise to the repulsion of the teaching.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_3: Not seeing the cause of extreme things, etc., don’t arise because of that.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_4: Not seeing the cause of extremely (wrong) things, etc., don’t arise because of the cause or condition.
ai-patthana7.22:1.1_5: Not longing for the Buddha’s teaching is not dependent, and because of the shackle of the floods, and so on.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of suspending the state of existence.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_1: Not for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of suspending the state of existence.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_2: Not for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of suspending the state of existence.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_3: Not longing for the sake of non-existence, nor do they arise for the sake of impingement, and for the sake of repulsion, because of this.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_4: Not longing for the sake of non-existence, nor do they arise for the sake of impingement, and for the sake of repulsion, because of this.
ai-patthana7.22:2.1_5: Not longing for the sake of non-existence, nor do they arise for the sake of impingement, and for the sake of repulsion, because of this.
ai-patthana7.22:3.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of grasping.
ai-patthana7.22:3.1_1: Not for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of sustaining the teaching, for the sake of function, and for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana7.22:3.1_2: Not for the sake of non-existence, etc., doesn’t give rise to the unarisen teaching. ...
ai-patthana7.22:4.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, nor do he gives rise to the flood by means of the impingement, repulsion, dependent on the inner skin, and for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana7.22:5.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, nor do he gives rise to the flood by means of the impingement, or for the sake of establishing the wrong conditions. ...
ai-patthana7.22:5.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana7.22:6.1_0: the thirty-two objects of each other ...
ai-patthana7.22:7.1_0: He should travel transmigrating with a wholesome, even if sinking Nuns, those who come close to it, or go wherever he’s told,
